summary: When colleges make false or misleading statements or omit information about their programs, students may have trouble completing a degree, paying back student loans, or finding a job. The Department of Education imposed penalties on 13 colleges when such actions amounted to "substantial misrepresentation" in FY 2016-21. title: Higher Education: Department of Education Should Improve Enforcement Procedures Regarding Substantial Misrepresentation by Colleges
